clinical_study.official_title: Platelet Rich Plasma in Secondary Spontaneous Pneumothorax

brief_summary.textblock: secondary spontaneous pneumothorax patients will be enrolled ,all of them will receive PRP with different doses and schedules

primary_outcome.measure: Air leak assessment by Cerfolio classification of the air leak by single observer
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 10 days after application of platelet rich plasma
primary_outcome.description: Continuous:Air leak is Present throughout the respiratory cycle Inspiratory : Present during the inspiration phase of the respiratory cycle. Expiratory: Present only during the expiratory phase of the respiratory cycle Forced expiration: Present only when the patient coughs or forces exhalation

primary_outcome.measure: physician assessment of complete lung inflation by absence of signs of pneumothorax in chest x ray done to the patient during hospital stay
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 10 days after application of platelet rich plasma
primary_outcome.description: no Chest x ray signs of pneumothorax i.e no jet balck translucency or border of collapsed lung) by physician interpretation

primary_outcome.measure: recurrence of pneumothorax by physician interpretation of Chest x ray done to the patient in follow up visit i.e detecting jet balck translucency or border of collapsed lung
primary_outcome.time_frame: one month after removal of intercostal tube
primary_outcome.description: no Chest x ray signs of pneumothorax i.e no jet balck translucency or border of collapsed lung) by physician interpretation

primary_outcome.description: no Chest x ray signs of pneumothorax i.e no jet balck translucency or border of collapsed lung) by physician interpretation

primary_outcome.description: no Chest x ray signs of pneumothorax i.e no jet balck translucency or border of collapsed lung) by physician interpretation

intervention.description: Application of platelet rich plasma through the intercostal tube into the pleural space

- COPD patients developed spontanous pneumothorax and was managed with intercostal tube insertion
Exclusion Criteria:
- refusal of participation
